sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些形容词均有"孤单的，寂寞的"之意。
means: lonely ： 强调孤独感，含"渴望和他人在一起"的意味。
alone ： 普通用词，指独自一人的状态，有时含孤寂之意。
desolate ： 语气强烈，强调遭受损失和失去亲人所带来的难以忍受的痛苦。
solitary ： 可指因被遗忘或遗弃而产生的孤独感，也可指人的生性孤僻。

sentence.Network_en: Ninety per cent of lone parent families are headed by mothers.
He was shot by a lone gunman.
sentence.Network_cn: 他被一名独行枪手射杀。

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: shortening of alone

entry.def: If you talk about a lone person or thing, you mean that they are alone.

example.ex: A lone woman motorist waited for six hours for help yesterday because of a name mix-up...
example.tran: 由于名字搞错了，一位独自开车的女子昨天等候救援的时间长达6小时。

example.ex: He was shot by a lone gunman.
example.tran: 他被一名独行枪手射杀。

entry.def: A lone parent is a parent who is looking after her or his child or children and who is not married or living with a partner.

example.ex: Ninety per cent of lone parent families are headed by mothers.

sentences.sentence: "he was alone when we met him"
"she is alone much of the time"
"a lonely fisherman stood on a tuft of gravel"

means.word_mean: 2. characterized by or preferring solitude in mode of life;

sentences.sentence: "the eremitic element in the life of a religious colony"

means.word_mean: 3. being the only one; single and isolated from others;

sentences.sentence: "the lone doctor in the entire county"

stems_affixes.word_buile: lone[adj.孤独的, 独立的]+ly表形容词→adj.孤独的,寂寞的
one一+ly表形容词→adj.唯一的, 单独的
lonely孤独的,寂寞的+ness表名词→n.孤独, 寂寞

stems_affixes.value_cn: 一次, 从前, 曾经
